comment: Dr. E, is a great professor, but I do feel like there are few things that you are graded by. Overall he is a caring professor, who engages with his classes. Just make sure to do your work, and if anything happens just talk to him.

The most GENUINE teacher ever, he is such a pure soul. The class is easy and it is paced in a way that ensures you aren't last minute rushing for assignments. He loves his students. Discussion posts were so easy! You get to completely choose your TED talk and final paper topic, the talk is online and easy, and he will go out of his way to help you!

Dr. Emilio is a great professor and if he is available for any English class, take him!! Writing is not my strong suit but Dr. Emilio was very generous in his grading and was very accessible outside of class. If you have any questions or concerns, Dr. Emilio will make it his priority to answer them!
He is genuinely the best English teacher I've ever had. Just go to class and have a good time. There are weekly discussion posts but they're quick.
His class is easy, he's super nice and not a harsh grader. If you try on your assignments you will get a good grade.

Great professor! Usually a discussion post and quiz due every week. attendance is mandatory but very helpful for assignments, you also get workshop points in class. Very relaxed grader, multiple large assignments due throughout. no exams, no final. but there is a research paper due at the end of the semester.

I would 100% recommend him. Attendance is mandatory, and there are usually 2 assignments due every week. Assignments are pretty easy and he's not a super tough grader. He walks you through everything and I actually enjoy attending class. I've learned far more beyond just English in this class. This is the type of class you come to college for!

He is an excellent professor! I have never enjoyed English classes but his class was one of my favorites. I don't consider myself a good writer but I did extremely well in his class. Although there are many assignments, it isn't enough to drown you. The assignments are not hard just time-consuming.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: He is a good professor and clearly knowledgable about the subject he teaches, however for such a basic class that doesn't matter to most people's majors I think he takes it a little too seriously. I missed the very first class because there was a monsoon and flooding and it tanked my grade so for the rest of the semester I was just fighting off a B
Best English prof at KSU!!! I 100% recommend him to everyone. He grades very nicely. He is fun and passionate of what he does

BEST english professor. Although class was mandatory we only met once a week. Very clear grading materials and makes sure everyone understands the assignments. Provides not just critique but praise on your work. If you are debating taking his course, don't. Best english class I have ever been in.
there's no way you can fail with him
He makes me love going to his class! GOO he is very easy and fun!

Great english teacher :) ! Really engaging and truly wants all his students to succeed. There are weekly discussion post and 3 essays. He's a lenient grader as long as he sees you are making an effort on each assignment. He's really good at breaking down what he expects from you on each essay. I plan on taking him for 1102 as well.
Literally the best professor I have had. He is so understanding and makes lectures interesting. PLEASE take him if you can!!!!!

He really made sure that every question was answered and that we understood everything. We did many group things. Be prepared to talk. He was a good grader. If you don't like writing, this course may be a little harder for you.

He is funny, kind, and helpful. There are 3 essays total, and they get progressively more difficult as the class goes on. There is quite a bit of peer review and group tasks. My harshest critique is that he gave us work over the Thanksgiving break. Ridiculous, unavoidable, and unnecessary. Regardless, one of the best English teachers I've had.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Emilio was a great teacher. Open to work with me while experiencing family issues. He gives very straightforward rubrics and the class consisted of 3 main essays plus a peer review for each, a few 250-word discussion posts requiring 1 response, and a few quick quizzes. He is very respectful and kind to his class. Would definitely recommend.

He was amazing, best prof ive had. You have a decent amount of work but he gives you ample time to get it done. He is an absolute sweetheart, he genuinely cares about his students. participation does matter so thats important.

Dr. Emilio is the best professor I have had so far. I have taken him for English 1101 and now 1102. He is very engaging and always makes class fun. Attendance is required, but class is only one day a week, so it makes sense. Participation also matters, which keeps class engaging. His class is the only one I actually looked forward to going to.
zesty man and too passionate about literature but a good professor

I overall loved his class!! He genuinely cares about his students and is very passionate for what he teaches. I enjoy coming to his class every day because it is fun. Listen to me TAKE HIM FOR 1101 AND 1102!!! It's hard to fail all you have to do is try. Also, there are extra credit opportunities!!

I was in his 1101 class, he made the class fun, I passed with an A, now im in his 1102 class, it got a lil harder but that's normal, he makes the class easy for you/ fun. There's weekly discussion post/ open note quizzes that are really easy. 3 major assignments; an annotation bib, ted talk, and your research paper. Take this class with Emilio!
I took him for 1101 and he was a really good and easy professor. Now I am in 1102 the work has become a lot more and really unnecessary. Overall nice guy though.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: One of the best professors at KSU, a fantastic approach to the subject.  Fair warning though, if you're someone who doesn't like talking in class you are graded on participation.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Amazing professor! Really wants you to succeed in writing and literature. Super fun, nice and caring. Will 100% take him again for future English.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: The most fun professor I've had so far! He's genuinely interested and passionate about what he teaches. If more professors were like him, I'd be a better student.

LOVE THIS GUY! Took him for my Eng 1102 back in Spring 2022 & about to take him for Spring 2023 for English 2110!! He's so passionate about literature & is so kind! Gives great feedback! Changed my view on KSU professors all around. He wants you to succeed & is willing to help you. Participation matters! TAKE HIM I promise!

Really great professor, he was genuinely interesting and made it fun to write. Highly recommend him for 1101 and I am planning on taking him for 1102 as well. Attendance isn't necessarily mandatory but he gives grades for in-class participation so you do kind of have to go to every class. It's a fun class though!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I took his Hybrid class and he honestly best professor yet. He gives ample time to finish papers and is really supportive. 10/10 would take his class again!!

Dr. Emilio is the best English teacher ever! I took him for ENGL 1101 and 1102. He's super caring, and he breaks down every assignment before it's due. 2/3 major essays, attendance is a grade, lots of discussion posts.

Dr. Emilio was overall a great professor. Approachable and caring. Attendance isnt required, but you do get grades for participation so itd be good to show up. He sets up the criteria and expectations for papers really nicely and gives great feedback on everything. Would definitely take again!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great professor! Very lenient and understanding. He makes class fun and offers a lot of extra credit. Attendance is mandatory or you won't earn points for the day.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: He is a great professor. I took him for english 1101 and 1102. Both of the classes were mostly based on 3 main essays, discussion posts/quizzes that are related to the essays. It is a hybrid course with only going once a week. Very helpful, and gives good feedback on major assignments.
Awesome professor! Always felt prepared for any quizzes, tests or papers.

Dr. Emilio is a very caring and approachable instructor. Had him for a hybrid course with one class a week, each class was mainly getting into groups and doing group participation alongside it. Wish there was less group work considering how well he engages when doing regular lectures. Show up to class, do the work before, ask for help, easy A.

For being his first year at Kennesaw, he was an amazing professor. Most of your grade relies on the essays. Other than that all of the other work is an easy A if you apply yourself. He gives great feedback and is very easy-going and helpful. I really enjoyed his class but you definitely have to work for it!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: One of the best professors on Campus. Really nice, appeals to everybody and makes time fly by in class.
Really nice & specific about assignments, discussion posts, essays are a majority of your grade. Willing to help
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: I loved professor Emilios class. You have three papers you have to do over all, and then outside of that occasionally a quiz over material from the text book or a weekly discussion post. Participation and attendance are mandatory and for a grade. Overall his class is enjoyable, highly recommend!

Love this guy. He is my favorite professor I have had thus far. Graded mostly on three essays... there's some other stuff but more than half your grade depends on these three. You have to show up but that's never really an issue because I enjoy his class. I recommend his 1 day a week class because, although it's listed as a hybrid, it's really not.

My first impression of him was that he'd make a good cult leader. He takes participation pretty seriously, so get ready to speak up in class. Aside from the three papers that make up 70% of your grade in total, it's easy to get a 100 on every assignment. He's approachable and clear with exactly what he wants you to write. Pretty interesting class.
